about.content: I am an aspiring software engineer studying Computer Science at Dartmouth. I began my coding career at Los Gatos High School, and since then have taken courses in Software Design and Implementation, Algorithms, Applied Cryptography, Full-Stack Web Development, Machine Learning and Statistical Analysis, among other areas.

At Dartmouth I have experience working as a teacher’s assistant and as a developer for HackDartmouth, the club which organizes the annual Dartmouth hackathon. I also had some amazing internships at Minerva Networks, Grove Collaborative, and NVIDIA.

Through my academics and professional experience, I’ve learned Java, Python, C, PHP, and Javascript. I’m familiar with frameworks such as React, React-Native, Node, and Flask. I’ve also used tools such as Airflow, Selenium, MongoDB, Docker and Heroku for deployment, and Git for version control.
Aside from CS, I spend most of my time playing ultimate frisbee with Dartmouth’s PainTrain and organizing Dartmouth’s annual hackathon with HackDartmouth.
